meanings.definition: A person who despises or scorns something or someone.
meanings.sent1: The contemners of modern art refuse to visit the museum.
meanings.sent2: The teacher warned the students not to become contemners of their classmates' ideas.
meanings.sent3: The contemners of vegetables were shocked when they found out they had to eat them for dinner.
meanings.sent4: She was a contemner of all things technology, preferring the simplicity of pen and paper.
meanings.sent5: The contemners of change found themselves left behind in a rapidly evolving world.

meanings.definition: To treat with contempt or scorn.
meanings.sent1: He contemners anyone who disagrees with him, refusing to listen to other opinions.
meanings.sent2: The bully contemners his classmates, making them feel small and insignificant.
meanings.sent3: The cat contemners the new toy, preferring to play with an old sock instead.
meanings.sent4: The politician contemners his opponents, using harsh words to belittle them.
meanings.sent5: She contemners the idea of giving up, always pushing forward despite challenges.
